Reassigning to Platform UI for comment.

This is what the execution flow here looks like. I've altered the code a bit, flattening it and replacing 
a variable or two with their values to reduce complexity.

1. The tree starts out like so:
  TreeItem - data: configuration type
    TreeItem - data: configuration
  TreeItem - data: configuration type

2. Then we remove the tree item containing the configuration (first line of code).
3. Next, we ask the tree for the children of the first configuration type. Since we just removed the 
configuration from the tree, I'd expect this to return an empty array on the third line of the code. 
4. Instead, we get an array containing a single TreeItem, with null data. Line 6 blows up when we 
pass the null data to the StructuredSelection constructor.

getTreeViewer().remove(configuration);
IStructuredSelection newSelection= null;
TreeItem[] configItems= getTreeViewer().getTree().getItems()[0].getItems();
int numItems= configItems.length;
if (numItems > 0) { // Select the item at the same index as the deleted
  newSelection= new StructuredSelection(configItems[0].getData());
} 

Why is the tree returning an empty node after we've told it to remove the configuration? Is there a 
problem with our code or is this a bug in the tree/treeviewer?
tod can you have a look here and add a response
Why was this bounced back to us?
I don't see any comments yet :-)

Is this a consistently replicatble case? You are accessing the tree directly 
and making assumptions about how things are mapped - we likely should not have 
elements with null values there but you are going a little wild.

If you use the tree viewer API do you get this - i.e. use the content provider 
and say getElements?

I cannot reproduce the error - but we have a null check in place now. I'm 
going to mark this as works for me.
